storyInfo: The Glasgow Gang returns home. Here, things are largely the same, but the people have changed. After they bemoan the lack of Vina, Vina shows up by her hungover friends' side. The war is finally over.

attributes.content: <p=1>Streets of Norport</><p=2>December 26th, 1098, 5:23 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: How'd things go on your end, Dagda?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Mr. Lane's still alive, but he's got a busted leg. His sworn brother didn't make it, though. I tried asking some old friends...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: None of them know when that brother passed away exactly. Might've been when trying to escape Norport, might've been some Sarkaz at the end of their tether during the allied counterattack...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Did you manage to see Mr. Lane himself?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I did. He works at the port now. He didn't bring up the old days, and he avoided talking about his crew.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: But he thinks that now, he's living a good life.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Bloody hell.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I strolled around one of the factories we used to look after. It's full of little punks now. None of those youngsters have even heard of us Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: That pack of brats deserves a right trashing!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Did you swing by the old restaurant we always went to?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Torn down. Parliament sent some men over to get in touch with all the old shopkeeps. Anything so run-down it couldn't be fixed up, and whose owner was missing, was slated to be torn down and rebuilt.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The pub on Sunset Street, Paul's Bar, the magazine stall that runt from Kazimierz ran... They're all gone.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I checked out that public cemetery they were talking about too. I couldn't find McClaren, or—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: (Choking back tears) Dammit, why don't these graves have names on them?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Stuff me, can't believe you caught me crying.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Let's head home already. Don't wanna leave Morgan waiting.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I thought... I thought the gym was going to be a rougher sight.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Looks to me like you've been taking care of the place this whole time.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I thought if you were still alive, you'd be coming back sooner or later. Doesn't matter how you look at it, I'm still part of the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You didn't get on Duke Windermere's ship with us back then—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I wasn't so far gone that I needed saving by the dukes.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But... I gotta admit, I was being a right fool back then. After all that, I took some of the crew out to fight some devils hanging around Norport.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I ended up hearing about the Exemplars from them.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You pulled off some crazy stunts I could never dream of. An army, hah... When the battle outside was in total chaos, some of the gang helped out on the front line with me.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But there wasn't much we could do. All I got in the end were a few cuts and bruises—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You're Infected too?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Yep. Heard the same happened to Indra after she took a bad scrape on the battlefield not too long ago.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: She's real lucky she had friends like you there with her.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Morgan stares blankly ahead. She'd never considered that problem. Not even Indra herself had.
No, no, that ain't right. Why do I feel all funny hearing you say that? Though I gotta admit I'm not sure what's not right about what you said.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hah, whatever you say. Anyway, if you ever get the chance, tell Siege I said sorry.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: If you stick around you can tell her yourself.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: My Glasgow Gang's long gone. Since you're coming back, it's only right that I head out.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Did Delphine not come back with you?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: She's standing by Vina's side.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hah, sounds like you lot had a squabble too. I heard about her mum from a broadcast... Doesn't matter who she might be, at least she's got some nerve.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Where you headed off to next?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Norport needs more hands to rebuild it, and the port's busy shuttling in goods from outside all day every day. Me and my crew are gonna keep an eye on it.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: And then... And then I'll head into Central to bash in some merchant bastard's head—Err...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: That's only a maybe. Norport's changed, Morgan.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: The folks I know are gone, and the shops too. There's some new gang of brats that's popped up. Don't know their arse from their elbow yet they're still trying to fight for dominance...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Anyway, I'm giving the gym back to you lot.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Parliament talked a big game in that broadcast of theirs. I talked it over with some of the boys. We'll wait a spell, then head over to some other dukedom to see what's what.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: We'll find a new turf.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: A new turf, a new beginning. I'll need some time to forget a few things.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Morgan, was that Cador leaving just now?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Yep.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: He came to say goodbye, and decided to hand this back to us while he was at it.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She pulls out a butterfly knife from her pocket. It's badly scratched, but the emblem of the Glasgow Gang can still be clearly seen.
Baird's butterfly knife. Hannah would recognize it anywhere. It was her who insisted on engraving that emblem once she beat Baird, after all.
Cador found it on the body of a cleaner... He couldn't find Baird herself, though.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I went there too.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: All I found was some stuff on the wall I didn't get. It's almost all gone, what with all the rain. But I'm sure...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I'm sure she was there. I saw her handwriting.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: 'I hope so too'...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.text: 'I hope so too.'
\nWhat did Baird hope for? We thought about it long and hard, but we were never able to make sense of it.
\nHer wishes had already been washed back into Norport's soil by the rain.
We decided not to dwell on it much longer.
\nWe never could guess her last little secret.
\nShe's definitely having a good laugh at us right now.

attributes.content: I remember that whenever we went to the video shop, Baird hated weepy scenes about grieving the most.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Yeah. She never thought death was worth being all that sad for.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Pass the knife to me. I'll think of a way to hang it up on the wall.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then I'll go get some drinks. To celebrate us coming home, and a toast to Baird!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Should we wait for Vina?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: She ain't got the time to come.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But just in case—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then we'll hold off right before we get completely pissed, Hannah.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Booze waits for no man.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: That day, without having to say a word on the matter, we all drank our drinks real slow.
\nWe were waiting for one more person.
\nIt seems there was a lot of chit-chat going on that day. Not that we remember any of it after the hangover.
All I remember is that Hannah and I got in a fight, and Dagda's brow got itself another scar. Why? None of us knew.
\nIf Vina were there, it'll all be fine. She always stayed the most sober out of all of us, and she'd remember for us.
\nBut she never showed up that day.

attributes.content: I dragged the body back, Boss.
attributes.name: Nervous Mercenary

attributes.content: But... Will this really be okay? I mean, snatching away the corpse of a condemned criminal from right under Parliament's nose—
attributes.name: Nervous Mercenary

attributes.content: Did you really think you could take that away without some silent approval from above?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: What of the Columbian?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: He's not in the best of moods... Boss, do we really need him to carry these goods? What if—
attributes.name: Nervous Mercenary

attributes.content: Millscar says nothing. The mercenary sighs.
Alright, I get it. Look, Boss, I'm not trying to make you mad. But ever since Parliament made a move on us, everyone's been on edge.
attributes.name: Nervous Mercenary

attributes.content: It doesn't concern you lot.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I'll handle the Columbian.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Eliseo. I presume I don't need to introduce myrself.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Millscar. I've heard about you.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Good, no need to waste words then. I need you to see this batch of goods out of Londinium safely.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You will, of course, receive payment. I can send this 'corpse' along with you.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Leave the city, and go as far away from it as you can.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Her name is Diane, Millscar.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Who she is isn't important to me.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: What's important is that she doesn't show her face again in Londinium.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You call this payment? Making someone who just got home leave again?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Eliseo, you are well aware she cannot stay in the city. As far as everyone is concerned, she is dead. Hanged from the gallows.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Vina made a mistake. So long as this person is alive and within the city, sooner or later someone is going to use her as a knife to stab Vina in the back.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: *sigh* She really must learn to be more decisive.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You know the condition of her infection better than I do, Eliseo. She doesn't have long.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You're welcome to refuse, of course. But I will still help Vina settle this matter. In my own way.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I know your story, Millscar. Or rather, Lady Allerdale Cumberland.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: There's a lot of versions of it out there, but they all agree you really did fit with the title of 'Cumberland the Ever on High', once upon a time.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Fine, I'll get Diane out of here. I can take better care of her back in Columbia.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Happy?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You're a good man, Eliseo. She's lucky to have made a friend in you.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Get ready. You could be leaving at any time.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You either die a hero, or you live long enough to see yourself become the villain.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Did you ever think you'd turn out this way?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Why ask just me?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Countless heroes lived through the war. From the most radiant of them to those that none remember. I too am curious as to how they will change in the face of reality.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Lying down amidst the meadow, the soldier senses a slight itch. The cold wind blows at the stalks of grass, and their tips tickle her face.
Is this what the land of the dead is like? She opens her eyes and sees someone most unexpected.
Huh—Wha—?!
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You're awake.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: It's me, Eliseo. You shouldn't just go off on your own to do dangerous stuff without a word, Diane.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I-I remember standing atop the gallows...
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: You're dead, at least to those who witnessed the execution.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Before we left, I asked the people at Rhodes Island to give you the once-over. It's not looking too good.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: A lot of your major organs have already begun to crystallize. In other words, Originium is replacing those organs.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: So... I'm not dead? Am I lucky or unlucky?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I'm not sure if the Speaker knew about this beforehand...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: So it was Vina who let me go? That's rather foolish of her.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: To tell you the truth, I really don't get some of you people. *sigh* Sorry, Diane. I'm afraid you can't go back to Londinium.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Only now does she realize they are no longer in Londinium. She sees the tell-tale giant tracks laid down by the nomadic city not too far off in the distance.
Just ahead of them, Sarkaz children run around in the meadow, waving at her as they pass.
Most displaced Sarkaz have lost the light in their eyes to confusion. They can go anywhere, but nowhere can they call home.
I'll be taking you to Columbia, Diane. I might be able to do more for you there.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Alright then. Columbia, eh...?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I still remember saying that if I get the chance, I'd love to see the place you keep talking about.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: How far are we from Columbia, Eliseo?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Well, still very far away. Let me get out my map—
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Will I be able to make it there in my condition? Walking the whole way?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: ...I see. Could you promise me one thing, Eliseo?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I know what you're going to ask, Diane.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: When the day comes, I'll bring you home. I'll bring you back to Londinium.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I'm rather curious myself as to how much the city would have changed by the time we return.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.text: The day we went back to the gym and got drunk, I had a dream.
\nIn that dream, there was a tomb, all dressed up to the nines. Our names were carved onto the plaques inside it—
'Morgan', Kate Morrigan... 'Indra', Hannah Jackson
\n'Dagda', Isabelle Montague... 'Baird', Brigit Lucan
Outside the tomb, there was a blazing carriage, and atop it sat a golden lion. He was calling my name.
\nVina Victoria.

attributes.content: Mmfh... Vina...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ...A blanket? Who put this blanket on me?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Urgh, my head hurts real bad. What time is it—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan, didn't I tell you not to drink like a sodding wino all the time?
Hah, considering how wild Hannah and the rest can get, shouldn't you be looking after them?
Eh...? Vina? Vina!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan nimbly launches herself out of the sofa, leaping over the short table to throw herself at Vina.
Vina, you came over!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I thought... I thought...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You thought what?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Why didn't you wake me, Hannah?!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Weren't you yapping and yowling yesterday about how she definitely wasn't coming?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Look at you. You turned out the most excited out of all of us.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: No I'm not!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Stubborn prick.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Quiet down, Morgan. Dagda's still asleep.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: (Mmph...)
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The one resting her head atop Indra's lap twitches her ears, still lost within a lovely drunken dream.
Seems like Dagda drank the most out of you lot. I tidied up a lot of empty bottles.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She must've been in a real rotten mood, Vina.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I just hope I'm not too late.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Well of course you're not!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Wasn't what you said yesterday, Morgan.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: (Shut it, Hannah!)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Welcome home, Vina!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I was really hoping to pop in earlier, but there's simply far too much to handle over at Parliament.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Then... How'd you...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm afraid I've given Horn another headache to deal with.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I suspect she'll only just have discovered I slipped away—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Then does that mean you need to head back?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I can't run away from my responsibilities.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But I owe you all an apology.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina, you don't need to—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Eh? Siege? Vina!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: How long've I been asleep?!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Relax, Vina's only just arrived back.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: That knife hanging on the wall—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's hers. Cador brought it back.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Cador?!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: Vina never brought up having to head back the whole day, but we all knew—
\nThat the Siege Vina, the boss of the Glasgow Gang, the ever-victorious king of the 'Slobberknocker', and (one of) my best friend(s) could leave us at any moment.
\nSo I was loathe to lose a single moment where I could tell Vina about all the changes in Norport that she hadn't had the chance to see yet...
Cador, Mr. Lane, the video shop...
\nThe reworked port, the rebuilt stores, a handful of old friends who rushed home after hearing the news...

\nOf course, who could forget the inexperienced little buggers who wanted to 'take over our gym'. After Vina beat them all to kingdom come with a smile on her face, they apologized by way of a few cartons of beer, and said they wanted to join us—
Seems like Norport's forgotten about us, but I don't think that's such a bad thing.
\nThe war really was over.

attributes.content: Do you still remember this place?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Why don't we get back to our little games, see who's fastest this time around?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Before Vina has even finished speaking, Indra has already begun to set off.
Hannah, you lousy cheat!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She didn't say nothing about a countdown. I'm still the champ here!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: You've gotten slower ever since your injury, Hannah.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Say that after you've caught up.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Eh? Wha—?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What's going on? Wait for me!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't fall behind, Delphine! Follow me!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Hear that, Del? You're a real slowpoke!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Several figures speed through the streets, and a few workers heading home after work give an inquisitive glance at the brash crew.
They can't quite seem to remember who this gang is—
'Must be another bunch of outsiders just arrived at Norport. Maybe.'
High above the gaps between the factories, the Glasgow Gang return to a favorite spot of theirs.
Here, they can look down upon the squatting factories, and look out at the Shard's pointed peak over at Central.
It was here that they started, and it was here that they left home. After a long period of wandering about, they have finally returned to this familiar place.
But—
I left a glass for Baird.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Sure you don't want a tipple, Dagda?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: No thank you. I'm not going to embarrass myself in front of Vina again.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I'll give your share to her, then.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Just fruit juice for you, Del?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Don't call me that. I'm still not too used to alcohol.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Suit yourself. I'll keep watch over you all.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Hell yeah! Finally, the part where we can start bloody drinking!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: To Baird! To the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: To Baird! To the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: To Rhodes Island! To the Exemplars!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: To everyone who fought in the war!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And, and, to all those who risked their lives coming home!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: To all those who live, and who left... To all those still by our side...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: To all those who shed blood and tears, to all those who struggle in darkness and in pain...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: ...To Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: To Victoria!
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: There is no need for sorrow. The living engrave the moment in their memories, while those who left leave behind their hopes and dreams.
The fowlbeasts croon as they spiral overhead, echoing their words.
You heading off too, Delphine?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Only for a short while. I need to go back to Lynncardine. Shearer will come along to recuperate.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If you ever get real fed up of those lousy bastards, you can always come back here.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This is your home too.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Of course I will! I promised Vina, after all.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If there's ever a day you feel like it's all too much for you, Vina—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I'll come back.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But I think I can handle it.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I hope the Londiniers can live in peace and happiness, and I hope that everyone can live their best lives. It's what they deserve.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Everyone should be like us. Smiling, without a tear in sight or an empty belly to be heard.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'm not going to let everything we've accomplished go to waste.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: If someone tries to take it from us, I'll be fighting back.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Just like how we looked after this place back then.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, Alexandrina, either's fine. There's no difference the way I see it. No?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: *burp*—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If Baird were here, that's what she'd want me to do.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You're right, Vina.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I really do hope so...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: To the Glasgow Gang. To all of you.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Welcome home, everyone.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.text: Vina left us on the morning of the day after. She didn't let us see her off. Maybe she didn't want to wake us.
\nIn truth, we were all awake. I watched her change into those clothes I was never fond of, and walk off on her lonesome towards Central Londinium.
\nI hope Vina managed to get a real good night's sleep, the best she's had in a long while. After all, it's only when she's at home that she doesn't need to think about anything.
I spent the entire night writing down everything that happened the day Vina came home, no matter how big or small.
I believe there will come a day that you, Vina, will read these words I wrote down.
\nThey might not be of too much use, but they can help you remember some of the more easily-forgotten things.
\nVina, do you still remember that dream I wrote about earlier?
In that dream, there was a tomb, all dressed up to the nines. Our names were carved onto the plaques inside it—
\nOutside the tomb, there was a blazing carriage, and atop it sat a golden lion. He was calling my name.
\nVina Victoria.
I dreamt I was you.
\nI dreamt of a time I was all old and withered, some afternoon decades after I lost touch with my Glasgow friends...
\nI walked into the tomb that 'Siege' built for the gang.
I cherish that unforgettable memory that is no longer mine. I cherish the tale that started in Norport.
\nVina, from the day you put on those clothes, I knew...
\nIn the end, you walk alone. You have no choice but to walk alone.
I'm sorry. There's no way for us to help you, or to stay by your side...
\nBut I wanted to let you know, we will always be here.
\nThe Glasgow Gang will always be here.
To you, Vina Victoria.
—'The Memoir of Alexandrina'
By Kate Morrigan
